page.title: 11FARMING - LIVESTOCK
page.content: Within thhe last two decades, the farming of dairy cows has changed considerably.Where there was once numerous milking herds in the area there are now only three. Two pedigree fresians and one channel island. The majority of farms have cross-bred beef herds of varying size, 70% of which are sold at the local markets of Heathfield and Hailsham. There are several large flocks of sheep in the area, mostly Kent or Kent cross.There was a piggery but no-one now has pigs on a commercial scale. Pheasant rearing was a very prevalent industry in the past and supplied birds on many large estates. Today there are no hatcheries - the birds are brought in as chicks by individual farmers for their own syndicates and this is one possible reason why the pheasant population is diminishing.
